([[2010 NBA Playoffs#(2) Orlando Magic vs. (3) Atlanta Hawks|eliminated 4-0]]) | bbr_team = ATL }}The '''[[2009â10 NBA season|2009â10]] Atlanta Hawks''' season was the 60th season of the [[Atlanta Hawks]] in the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA). The team was eliminated in the second round of the [[2010 NBA Playoffs]] on May 10 by the [[Orlando Magic]]. ==Key dates== *'''June 25''' - The [[2009 NBA Draft]] took place in [[New York City]]. *'''July 8''' - The [[free agent|free agency]] period started. ==Draft picks== {{main|2009 NBA Draft}} ==Roster== {{NBA roster header|team=Atlanta Hawks }} {{player2 | num = 10 | first = Mike | last = section|date=July 2010}} ==Transactions== {| border=1 style="border-collapse:collapse; background-color:#eeeeee" bordercolor="#DFDFDF" cellpadding="5" |- |
[[Atlanta Hawks]]

| valign="top"|Players Added
'''Via Draft''' *[[Jeff Teague (basketball)|Jeff Teague]] *[[Sergiy Gladyr]] '''Via Trade''' *[[Jamal Crawford]] (From [[Golden State Warriors|Warriors]]) '''Via Free Agency''' *[[Mike Bibby]] (From [[Atlanta Hawks|Re-signed]]) *[[Zaza Pachulia]] (From [[Atlanta Hawks|Re-signed]]) | valign="top"|Players Lost
'''Via Trade''' *[[Acie Law IV]] (To [[Golden State Warriors|Warriors]]) *[[Speedy Claxton]] (To [[Golden State Warriors|Warriors]]) *[[David Andersen]] (Rights to [[Houston Rockets|Rockets]]) |} === Trades === On June 25, 2009 the Hawks traded guards [[Acie Law IV]] and [[Speedy Claxton]] to the [[Golden State Warriors|Warriors]] for guard [[Jamal Crawford]]. === Signs === On July 7, 2009 the Hawks re-signed veteran point guard [[Mike Bibby]] to a 3-year deal worth $18 million. On July 8, 2009 the Hawks re-signed center [[Zaza Pachulia]] to a 4 year deal at $4.75 mil per year. On August 14, 2009 the Hawks and unrestricted free agent forward [[Joe Smith (basketball)|Joe Smith]] agreed to terms on a 1 year contract at the veteran's minimum. ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{Atlanta Hawks}} {{Atlanta Hawks seasons}} {{2009â10 NBA season by team}} {{DEFAULTSORT:2009â10 Atlanta Hawks Season}} [[Category:Atlanta Hawks seasons]] [[it:Atlanta Hawks 2009-2010]]
